org.kocakosm.pitaya.util

Class BaseEncoding

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.util.BaseEncoding

  • public final class BaseEncoding
extends Object
    RFC 4648 encoding scheme. Instances of this class are immutable.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK
    See Also:
    RFC 4648

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static BaseEncoding BASE_16
      Base16 encoding scheme.
      static BaseEncoding BASE_32
      Base32 encoding scheme.
      static BaseEncoding BASE_32_HEX
      Base32 encoding scheme with extended Hex alphabet.
      static BaseEncoding BASE_64
      Base64 encoding scheme.
      static BaseEncoding BASE_64_URL
      Base64 encoding scheme with URL and filename safe alphabet.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decode(String in)
      Decodes the given encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
      byte[] decode(String in, int off, int len)
      Decodes the specified range from the given encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
      String encode(byte... in)
      Encodes the given data bytes according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
      String encode(byte[] in, int off, int len)
      Encodes the given data bytes according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
      BaseEncoding ignoreUnknownCharacters()
      Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it ignores any unknown character when decoding encoded data.
      BaseEncoding withoutPadding()
      Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it doesn't append padding when encoding data and treats any padding character as an unknown character when decoding encoded data.
      BaseEncoding withSeparator(String separator, int n)
      Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it adds the specified separator after every n characters when encodind data and ignores any occurence of the specified separator when decoding encoded data.

    • Method Detail

      • withSeparator

        public BaseEncoding withSeparator(String separator,
                                  int n)
        Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it adds the specified separator after every n characters when encodind data and ignores any occurence of the specified separator when decoding encoded data. See RFC 4648 section 3.1 for more details.
        Parameters:
        separator - the separator to use.
        n - the number of characters between two successive separators.
        Returns:
        a BaseEncoding with the desired configuration.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if separator is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if separator contains any alphabet or padding characters or if n <= 0.

      • withoutPadding

        public BaseEncoding withoutPadding()
        Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it doesn't append padding when encoding data and treats any padding character as an unknown character when decoding encoded data. Also, note that since Base16 encoding scheme does not need padding, it is not affected by this method call. See RFC 4648 section 3.2 for more details.
        Returns:
        a BaseEncoding with the desired configuration.

      • ignoreUnknownCharacters

        public BaseEncoding ignoreUnknownCharacters()
        Returns a BaseEncoding that behaves as this one except that it ignores any unknown character when decoding encoded data. See RFC 4648 section 3.3 for more details.
        Returns:
        a BaseEncoding with the desired configuration.

      • encode

        public String encode(byte... in)
        Encodes the given data bytes according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
        Parameters:
        in - the data bytes to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.

      • encode

        public String encode(byte[] in,
                     int off,
                     int len)
        Encodes the given data bytes according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
        Parameters:
        in - the input buffer.
        off - the input offset.
        len - the number of bytes to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than in's length.

      • decode

        public byte[] decode(String in)
        Decodes the given encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration. Decoding is not case-sensitive when possible (namely for Base16, Base32 and Base32Hex schemes).
        Parameters:
        in - the input String.
        Returns:
        the decoded data.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if in is not a valid base-encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.

      • decode

        public byte[] decode(String in,
                     int off,
                     int len)
        Decodes the specified range from the given encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration. Decoding is not case-sensitive when possible (namely for Base16, Base32 and Base32Hex schemes).
        Parameters:
        in - the input String.
        off - the input offset.
        len - the number of characters to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded data.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if in is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than in's length.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified character range in in is not a valid base-encoded String according to this BaseEncoding's configuration.
